metadata.dc:author: Obeso González, T
Castellanos Ortega, A
Santridrián Miguel, J P
Teja Barbero, J L
Prieto Valderrey, F
metadata.dc:description: Adult respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) seems to be the common way from different etiologies. We describe the clinical evolution of an ARDS in a pregnant woman, initially due to Varicella Pneumonia which was complicated with Disseminated Candidiasis and recurrent ARDS. We review the nosocomial infection with Candida in ICU patients: the growing incidence, the diagnostic problems and the new standards for treatment.
metadata.dc:title: SDRA recurrente tras neumonía varicelosa complicado con candidiasis diseminada en mujer gestante.
[Recurrent ARDS in varicella pneumonia complicated by disseminated candidiasis in a pregnant woman].
